identificationModule.officialTitle: Chronic Thromboembolic Disease: A Prospective Registry

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
The goal of this patient registry is to learn about the natural history in patients with chronic thromboembolic disease (CTD) and/or chronic thromboembolic pulmonary hypertension (CTEPH). The main question\[s\] it aims to answer are:

* Long-term outcome after various types of treatment, including medication, balloon pulmonary angioplasty, and pulmonary endarterectomy
* Effect of treatment on patient's quality of life and exercise tolerance Participants will be followed longitudinally to assess their health outcomes and quality of life via chart review and health quality surveys.

armGroups.label: Chronic thromboembolic disease
armGroups.description: Patients with chronic thromboembolic disease/pulmonary hypertension

interventions.name: Survey
interventions.description: Patients who received medical, surgical or interventional treatment for chronic thromboembolic pulmonary hypertension will be followed and given quality of life questionnaires.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Total number of patients who survive
primaryOutcomes.description: The total number of patients who are alive
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 5 years

primaryOutcomes.description: Measured by 6-min walk test, which will be done approximately every 3 months at follow up per standard of care
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline to end of the study, an average of 5 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in supplemental oxygen use severity
primaryOutcomes.description: Number of patients on supplemental oxygen, which will be recorded approximately every 3 months at follow up per standard of care. This will be compiled at the end of the study to provide overall change in measurement.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline to end of the study, an average of 5 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in New York Heart Association (NYHA) functional class
primaryOutcomes.description: Grading of patients by NYHA functional class, which include functional capacity and objective assessment. This will be compiled at the end of the study to provide overall change in measurement.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline to end of the study, an average of 5 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: European Quality of Life Five Dimension (EQ-5D) - Scale Score
primaryOutcomes.description: Assessment of quality of life will be measured using EQ-5D-5L. This instrument is a self-assessed, health-related, quality of life questionnaire that measures quality of life on a 5-component scale. The scores range from Level 1 to Level 5, with lower scores indicating a higher quality of life. This will be collected every 3 months and compiled at the end of the study to provide overall change in measurement.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline to end of the study, an average of 5 years

primaryOutcomes.description: Assessed by the emPHasis-10 (pulmonary hypertension) instrument, which is an instrument specifically designed to assess the quality of life in patients with pulmonary hypertension. Each item will be scored from 0 to 5 where 0 was the best score. This will be collected every 3 months and compiled at the end of the study to assess overall change in measurement.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline to end of the study, an average of 5 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of patients undergoing lung transplantation
primaryOutcomes.description: Number of patients undergoing lung transplantation
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline to end of the study, an average of 5 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: The frequency and dose of medication specifically for management of CTEPH or CTED, which will be assessed approximately every 3 months as routine medical follow up. This will be compiled at the end of the study to assess overall change.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline to end of the study, an average of 5 years

secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of patients undergoing pulmonary endarterectomy
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 5 years

secondaryOutcomes.measure: History of undergoing pulmonary balloon angioplasty
secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of patients undergoing pulmonary balloon angioplasty
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 5 years

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients referred with CTED and/or CTEPH defined as:

  1. Mean pulmonary arterial pressure (mPAP) \> 20 mmHg at rest with pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) \> 2 Wood units (WU); or if mPAP ≤ 20 mmHg or PVR ≤ 2 WU at rest, have exercise limitations from chronic thromboembolic pulmonary disease (CTEPD) without pulmonary hypertension (PH)
  2. Radiologic finding of chronic thromboembolic disease, including abnormal ventilation perfusion scan, pulmonary angiogram, computer tomographic pulmonary angiogram, or magnetic resonance pulmonary angiogram
  3. Post-embolic exercise intolerance and evidence of chronic thromboembolic disease in the absence of resting pulmonary hypertension
* Treatment with anticoagulation for ≥ 3 months before diagnosis of CTEPH or CTEPD without PH
* Age ≥ 18 years

Exclusion Criteria:

* Main cause of PH other than World Health Organization (WHO) group 4 (CTEPH)
* Patient's refusal to participate in clinical research and/or receive intervention
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients with diagnosed chronic thromboembolic disease (CTED) or chronic thromboembolic pulmonary hypertension (CTEPH)
